data.name: Absol

attacks.name: Allure
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.flavorText: Because of this Pokémon's ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.

data.name: Krookodile

attacks.name: Vengeful Fang
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 160 more damage.

data.flavorText: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.

data.name: Toxel

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel's body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.

data.name: Toxtricity

abilities.name: Sinister Surge
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for a Basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Darkness Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, place 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: As it scatters toxic sweat and emits electricity, a melody that sounds like it came from a guitar reverberates through the surrounding area.

data.name: Eternatus

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

attacks.name: Power Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't use attacks.

data.flavorText: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.

data.name: Empoleon ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Emperor's Stance
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

attacks.name: Iron Feathers
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 60 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.flavorText: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

data.name: Bronzong

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Tool Drop
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each Pokémon Tool attached to all Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: When it's in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

data.name: Duraludon

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Duraludon's body is comprised of a special metal that's lightweight and scratch resistant. It's also smooth, as though it was given a mirror finish.

data.name: Archaludon

attacks.name: Coated Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.

data.name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

data.name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has the Round attack.

data.flavorText: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

data.name: Aipom

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand, and your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.

data.name: Ambipom

attacks.name: Dual Tail
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack does 60 damage to each of 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.

data.name: Smeargle

attacks.name: Energizing Sketch
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. Attach an amount of Basic Energy up to the number of heads from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: Once a Smeargle reaches adulthood, it will have other members of its species leave paw prints on its back.

data.name: Zigzagoon

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an interest in everything, so it always zigzags.

data.name: Linoone

abilities.name: Excited Dash
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, and if you have any Mega Evolution Pokémon ex in play, you may use this Ability. Switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.

data.name: Buneary

attacks.name: Run Around
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and then striking with the force created by unrolling them. This attack becomes stronger with training.

data.name: Mega Lopunny ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gale Thrust
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 170 more damage.

attacks.name: Spiky Hopper
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Battle Cage
rules: Prevent all damage counters from being placed on Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) by effects of attacks and Abilities from the opponent's Pokémon. (Damage from attacks is still taken.)
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Blowtorch
rules: You can use this card only if you discard a Basic Fire Energy card from your hand.  Discard a Pokémon Tool or Special Energy card from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon, or discard a Stadium in play.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Dawn
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, a Stage 1 Pokémon, and a Stage 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Dizzying Valley
rules: Confused Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) don't recover from that Special Condition when they evolve or devolve.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Firebreather
rules: Search your deck for up to 7 Basic Fire Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Grimsley's Move
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck and put a Darkness Pokémon you find there onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards and put them on the bottom of your deck. You can't use this card during your first turn.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Jumbo Ice Cream
rules: Heal 80 damage from your Active Pokémon that has 3 or more Energy attached.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Punk Helmet
rules: If the Darkness Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), place 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Sacred Charm
rules: The Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have an Ability (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Wondrous Patch
rules: Attach a Basic Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Psychic Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Ludicolo

abilities.name: Excited Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you have any Grass Mega Evolution Pokémon ex in play, you may use this Ability. Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There are structures throughout its whole body that produce energy when hit by sound waves with a cheerful rhythm.

data.name: Nymble

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

data.name: Dewgong

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Fire or Water Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it's colder.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Call for Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

data.name: Yamper

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

data.name: Zacian

attacks.name: Limit Break
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: Able to cut down anything with a single strike, it became known as the Fairy King's Sword, and it inspired awe in friend and foe alike.

data.name: Flygon

abilities.name: Sandy Flapping
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. You may also use this Ability if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon. Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: Known as the Desert Spirit, this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.

data.name: Paldean Wooper

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It's dangerous for Wooper to travel alone. They line up in groups of three or four and help each other as they walk around the wetlands.

data.name: Toxtricity

abilities.name: Sinister Surge
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for a Basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Darkness Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, place 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: As it scatters toxic sweat and emits electricity, a melody that sounds like it came from a guitar reverberates through the surrounding area.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: When it's in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

data.name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has the Round attack.

data.flavorText: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines, too.

data.name: Ambipom

attacks.name: Dual Tail
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack does 60 damage to each of 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.

data.name: Mega Heracross ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Juggernaut Horn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

attacks.name: Mountain Ramming
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Mega Charizard X ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Inferno X
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Fire Energy from among your Pokémon, and this attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Oricorio ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Excited Turbo
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, if you have any Fire Mega Evolution Pokémon ex in play, you may use this Ability. Attach a Basic Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Fire Pokémon.

data.name: Rotom ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Multi Adapter
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has "Rotom" in its name may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached. If this Ability goes away, discard Pokémon Tools from those Pokémon until only 1 remains on each.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Mismagius ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Swirling Prose
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon moves to the Bench during their turn, their new Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hexa-Magic
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Mega Sharpedo ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Greedy Fang
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Hungry Jaws
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.name: Empoleon ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Emperor's Stance
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

attacks.name: Iron Feathers
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 60 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Mega Lopunny ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gale Thrust
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 170 more damage.

attacks.name: Spiky Hopper
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Grimsley's Move
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck and put a Darkness Pokémon you find there onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards and put them on the bottom of your deck. You can't use this card during your first turn.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Punk Helmet
rules: If the Darkness Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), place 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Sacred Charm
rules: The Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have an Ability (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Ignition Energy
rules: If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn.  As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.  If this card is attached to an Evolution Pokémon, it provides ColorlessColorlessColorless Energy instead.

data.name: Mega Charizard X ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Inferno X
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Fire Energy from among your Pokémon, and this attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has "Rotom" in its name may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached. If this Ability goes away, discard Pokémon Tools from those Pokémon until only 1 remains on each.

attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.
